alert.note: Alert for Clarendon; Lee; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 06 at 11:16PM EDT until June 07 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Lee County in central South Carolina... Northeastern Clarendon County in central South Carolina... Northeastern Sumter County in central South Carolina... * Until midnight EDT. * At 1116 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles north of Sumter County Airport, or 9 miles southwest of Bishopville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. * Locations impacted include... Woods Bay State Park, Elliott, Turbeville, Mayesville, Lynchburg, Ashwood, Oswego, Manville, St. Charles, Shiloh, Wisacky, Woodrow, Dalzell and Central Crossroads. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 110 and 123. Interstate 95 between mile markers 136 and 146. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection seek shelter inside a sturdy building and stay away from windows. Excessive cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
